Prompt: How do I schedule a workorder?
Answer:
```html Schedule a Work Order

How to Schedule a Work Order

  • Select Work > WO Planning > WO Scheduling.
  • Provide the following information:
    • Organization - Specify the organization for which to schedule work if you use multi-organization security.
    • Schedule By - Choose the scheduling method:
      • Employee - If selecting to schedule by employee, enter the employee's name in the provided field.
      • Trade/Department - If selecting to schedule by trade/department, provide the trade and department details in the respective fields.
  • After specifying the required information, click on the Save Hours button.
  • Repeat the previous steps as needed to allocate any additional hours to the work order activity.
  • Finally, click on the Save Record button to complete the scheduling process.

This instruction is based on the documentation provided and uses the system-specific terminology as requested.

```

Prompt: How do I schedule a Workorder?
Answer:
```html Scheduling a Work Order

How to Schedule a Workorder

To schedule a work order, please follow these steps:

  • Select Work > WO Planning > WO Scheduling.
  • Specify the required information:
    • Organization - Specify the organization for which to schedule work if you use multi-organization security.
    • Schedule By - Select one of the following options:
      • Employee - Select to schedule by employee. Enter the Employee for whom you wish to schedule the work.
      • Trade/Department - Select to schedule by trade/department. Enter the Trade and Department.
  • Click Save Hours.
  • Repeat the above steps as necessary to book any additional hours against the work order activity.
  • Click Save Record.

For detailed instructions, visit the official documentation site:

Source

Prompt: How do I schedule a Workorder?
Answer:
```html Scheduling a Work Order

Scheduling a Work Order

  • Select Work > WO Planning > WO Scheduling.
  • Specify the following information:
    • Organization - Specify the organization for which to schedule work if you use multi-organization security.
    • Schedule By - Select one of the following options:
      • Employee - Select to schedule by employee. The system displays Employee. Enter, for Employee, the Employee for whom you wish to schedule the work.
      • Trade/Department - Select to schedule by trade/department. The system displays Trade and Department. Enter, for Trade and Department, the trade and department for which you wish to schedule the work.
  • Click Save Hours.
  • Repeat these steps as necessary to book any additional hours against the work order activity.
  • Click Save Record.

The above instructions are based on the provided documentation.

```

Prompt: How do I schedule a workorder?
Answer:
```html Scheduling a Work Order

Steps to Schedule a Work Order

  • Select Work > WO Planning > WO Scheduling.
  • Specify the following information:
    • Organization - Specify the organization for which to schedule work if you use multi-organization security.
    • Schedule By - Select one of the following options:
      • Employee - Select to schedule by employee. The system displays Employee. Enter the Employee for whom you wish to schedule the work.
      • Trade/Department - Select to schedule by trade/department. The system displays Trade and Department. Enter the trade and department for which to schedule the work.
  • Click Save Hours.
  • Repeat these steps as necessary to book any additional hours against the work order activity.
  • Click Save Record.

The above process is based on the documentation provided.

Additional Information

You can also schedule backlogged work orders by following these steps:

  • Select Backlogged WOs for Dataspy in the Activities section of the form.
  • Select a work order from the list and drag it to the day on the calendar for which to schedule it.
  • The system creates a new work order schedule record.

Refer to the original Hexagon Documentation for more details.

Source ``` This response is based on the provided context documentation.
